title: Personal Quick Customer Notes
customernote: Dear ITSMO team, This is obviously not the highest priority on your plate today, but I have a question for when you get a chance after TDX roll-out. Many of us have accumulated quite a few personal Quick Customer Notes (e.g. I have good couple dozens, and they are tremendously helpful). Is there a way to do a mass download of my existing quick notes (like a zip archive with one text file per note, or similar)? Anything that is more efficient than me copy-pasting one by one? Thanks, name Rosen Center for Advanced Computing (RCAC) Hi name, Unfortunately, TeamDynamix does not have the ability for individual technicians to have their own custom signatures. There are a few that are created globally that are very generic (called "templates" if you are updating a ticket) and we are discussing creating a few more for the Service Desks, but not oodles for anyone. If your groups or unit have a handful of templates that can be shared amongst them, we can configure a catagory and create them in the PurdueIT Tickets app in TDX. Not the answer you were looking for, I'm sure. We've found a few bummers, but we'll see if we can accommodate you need as best we can. name Courtney  Where does this go? On 7/11/23, 3:22 PM, "Purdue Customer Support" wrote: [Duplicate message snipped]  Hi name, Sorry this isn't a functionality in TDX. name mentioned that you all may be working on a short list for us to add as Response Templates. name's also looking into another solution to help with this issue. name Courtney  Thank you name, sorry I got swamped and did not follow up timely on Friday! Yes, we will work on a small set of generic team-wide templates... while better than nothing, the lack of this functionality on the individual level is really sad and kind of shocking. Hope name could find a working alternative! :) But aside from TDX, my original question was not about importing my quick notes into TDX, but rather about *exporting* my current collection out from FootPrints. Is there any way to mass-download all my notes (as opposed to painfully and tediously copying them out one by one)? Thanks, name  Sorry name, I know of no way to do an export of your quick notes through the tool. The DBAs may be able to find this information, but I have not idea if this is something they would entertain doing. name Courtney

title: Gilbreth Access Issue
customernote: Hello,Thank you for contacting the Purdue IT Service Desk. I have forwarded your ticket to our Support team who will be able to further assist you. If you have any other issues or questions, please reply to this email or call us at . Thank you, SennaPurdue IT Service Deskwww.purdue.edu/goldanswers For Tech Support:West Lafayette: or (765) 494-4000IUPUI: or (317) 274-4357Purdue Northwest: or (219) 989-2888Purdue Fort name: or (  Hi name, Thank you for contacting us. I didn't see you have access to Gilbreth at the moment. In order to get access to our clusters, you need to be added into a group which has purchased our cluster resources. So you need to find a faculty at Purdue (your PI or PIs for other groups) who has purchased computing resources (e.g. Gilbreth) to accommodate you in the group and grant your access to the resources this group has. title: access to brown cluster
customernote: Hello, When i am trying to log in to name cluster remote desktop website, its redialing me to the login page. Please help. Username jdanao https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/compute/name [https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/files/resources/name/resource.jpg]<https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/compute/name<https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/compute/name is a Community Cluster optimized for communities running traditional, tightly-coupled science and engineering applications. name was... www.rcac.purdue.edu Thank you, name Graduate Student Purdue University Department of Horticulture & Landscape Architecture Horticulture Building, 625 Agriculture Mall Drive West Lafayette, IN 47907-2010  Hi name, Thank you for contacting us. This is because your home directory is full so ThinLinc (Remote Desktop) cannot create or modify files in $HOME which is essential during its startup. The solution would be clean up some spaces in your home directory by either deleting or moving out files from the home directory. You can fulfill this task through actions via gateway.name -> Files -> Home Directory or through ssh to name. Please give it a try and let me know if it works.
